abstract: Unilever is preparing to reduce its work force 11 percent over the next four years to speed up a recovery program aimed at narrowing the gap with Procter & Gamble.
snippet: Unilever is preparing to reduce its work force 11 percent over the next four years to speed up a recovery program aimed at narrowing the gap with Procter & Gamble.
lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 2 — Unilever, the maker of Dove soap, Vaseline cream and Knorr soup, said on Thursday that it plans to cut 20,000 jobs over the next four years to speed up a recovery program aimed at narrowing the gap with Procter & Gamble.

headline.print_headline: Unilever to Cut 20,000 Jobs Over 4 Years to Gain on P.&G.
